Content: so it looks like we dropped the ball a bit on innovation. Actually I don't think robots that do some chores would be particularly hard to build, but they would probably be so expensive it might be cheaper to a) do it yourself, or b) hire a maid

Author: chaostheory

Author: karzeem
Content:
Drug companies have been advertising this way to doctors for years. They often hold lectures and give out educational tchotchkes that many doctors find genuinely useful. In fact, drug company lectures and educational materials are the main way that a lot of doctors keep up on new developments in their field.

(All this, of course, is notwithstanding the bad parts about drug companies giving doctors free stuff).

Author: nickb
Content: Thousands... one of them was Charles Simony for sure.

Title: Justin.TV Lifecasters Not Welcome Everywhere (like movie theaters)

Author: carter
Content:
Hmm...I'm afraid I don't understand why do you considering using P2P unconvenient. Cos here in Russia it is the most comfortable way to get music. Internet music market is only a few $millions for now. But even if it will grow, I doubt that people will drop P2P. Cos it easy as open StrongDC++ in your metropolian network, type an artist name and download all songs at the price $0,0004 per mb.
Maybe I'm wrong and you have different situation in US.
Just my 2 cents.

Author: cdr
Content: Having ads attached seems like a potentially pretty high cost to me.
